analysis.title: Strategic Advantage and Counter Positioning Analysis
analysis.content: Seven powers. Benefits are much rarer than barriers. Barriers are rarer than benefits. The other example for counter positioning that I didn't look at earlier is Netflix versus HBO. When Netflix came out with OTT, HBO couldn't respond to them immediately mainly because they had all these lucrative contracts with the network providers. If they went OTT, it would sabotage their relationship with the network providers, which was a significant revenue and profit-making center for them. So they had to wait before they could respond. Another aspect to consider is the materiality of your strategic advantage - the three S's which are superiority, significance, and sustainability. When you have an advantage or a benefit or a barrier, consider how superior, significant, and sustainable it is.
key_insights: Importance of considering strategic advantage and counter positioning in business decisions
